page.title: 01Dereham - an introduction
page.content: Dereham is a market town in the heart of Norfolk set in an area of flat, mainly arable land. It has a population of 12,000. A Parish Council of elected townsfolk are led by the Town Mayor who is elected annually. The Church dates from the 12th Century and has a detached 16th Century Bell Tower. St. Withburga's Well is in the Churchyard. Secondary School children are bussed into the town for their education, and many people come into the town to work in banking, insurance, shops, and in the furniture, clock and vehicle factories. The Local Government Authority, Breckland District Council, has many of its offices in the Town. The village of Scarning adjoins the town but has its own identity, Parish Council,Church and School.
